peopleAlsoAsk.question: How to tell if wood is antique?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: To identify if furniture is antique, look for signs like dovetail joints, patina, craftsmanship, and hardware style. Examine the wood for aging signs, such as warping or discoloration. Research the maker's mark or labels for authenticity. For expert advice, explore my Quora Profile!
peopleAlsoAsk.title: How to tell if a dresser is antique - Quora

peopleAlsoAsk.question: What is the 100 year rule for antiques?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: The customary definition of antique requires that an item should be at least 100 years old and in original condition. (Motor vehicles are an exception to this rule, with some definitions requiring an automobile to be as little as 25 years old to qualify as an antique.)
